## PROBLEM 1
### GIBBS SAMPLER       
```{r}
rm(list = ls())
binomial_beta_gibbs<- function(theta_init, s_init, rho, niter){
  theta = matrix(0,2,niter)
  theta[1,] = theta_init
  for(i in 2:niter){
    theta[1,i] = rnorm(1,y[1]+rho*(theta[2,(i-1)]-y[2]),1-rho^2)
    theta[2,i] = rnorm(1,y[2]+rho*(theta[1,i]-y[1]),1-rho^2)
  }
  return(theta)
}

y = c(-1,1)
theta_init = c(0,0)
niter = 500
rho = 0.8

theta <- binorm_gibbs(theta_init,y,rho,niter)

plot(t(theta),type="l")
plot(t(theta),type="p")
```
